activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
10/26/2022 date on preliminary hearing calendar rescheduled due to power outage.
Motion for compassionate release furlough
from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today. 2,580 contacts

10:49 AM Defendant Damarion Taylor in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
SPD has made over 2,000 attempts.
Defendant wishes to proceed pro se 
State asks for adjournment.
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.

3:09 PM Defendant Damarion Taylor in court, in custody.  Attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
SPD has not yet appointed counsel for defendant.
Defendant would like to be able to sit 2nd chair.
Court explains that there is no such thing as pro se 2nd chair.
Defendant is still hoping to have counsel appointed, however, he wants to file motions on his own.
Court holds colloquy with defendant on his right to proceed pro se and questions defendant on this.
BTC: Defendant is able to understand and act pro se in his defense.  Defendant has knowingly, willingly, intelligently elected to proceed pro se on this case until an attorney is appointed for defendant and is permitted to appear pro se.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim K.M, T.M, H.M and M.C (person, property, residence or family). Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

2:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Damarion Taylor appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst appeared by video for Damarion Taylor. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
